answers.answer: You might want to tell us why you think it is something else. Symptoms, so to speak.The only info I have so far is that you are a badly controlled type 1 diabetic.No offence, but I have a badly controlled type one diabetic as a friend, but he just drinks too much beer. No sign of Lupus or MS there.

I am excessively tired, even after a night of sleep, especially in early afternoon. I lived 9000 ft. altitutude for 6 yr. and made frequent trips to way lower altitude (I heard this could cause ms). Moved to Okla. 7 mths. ago, balance has been very unsteady since. I do not have a job & can't afford a lot of doctor visits...just trying to determine if I should go to the expense of being tested for ms?

Your problems could also be cuased by high blood sugar, which causes peripheral neuopathy and can also affect balance.Recommend you work at controlling your blood sugar as a big priority, which may help everything else.Lower carb diet may also help make your sugars more predicable and controllable.

question: wondering if i could have lupus or ms. i am a type 1 diabetic...have been for 34 years. i am not in super good control of my diabetes.
title: help with ms/lupus/diabetes question
